page.title: 02THIS YEAR'S WEATHER.
page.content: The weather in this area is heavily influenced by the Pennines. It has been shown that rain systems tend to break up as they cross the Pennines however Keighley still gets above average average rainfall for this area.In{1984}the highest temperature recorded was {28'C.}The summer was hot and dry causing some worries over the water supply for parts of the area. Overall though a very wet autumn and winter ensured that the year's total rainfall was above average.The lowest temperature of the winter{1984/5}was {-8'C}recorded in February.The summer of {1985}has been extremely wet and dull with only one full week of summer weather.The average temperature for June is normally about{20'C,}this year it was only{16.9'C}with a low of just{ {9.5'C! }
